# The Effects of Mount St. Helens Eruption

![Mount St. Helens](data:image/jpeg;base64,)

**Mount St. Helens, National Volcanic Monument State Park, Washington State.**





## Mount St. Helens Eruption
Mount St. Helens erupted on **May 18th, 1980**, destroying the area around it. Causing many to lose their lives and their homes. While the effects of this natural disaster was tremendous, there are many positives to come from its occurance. The main thing to note is the further advancement in technology that took place after it happened. Because of the eruption, the evolution of tools such as *photogrammetry, GIS and lidar* advancements allowed scientist to make better measurements and illustrations of the Earth's surfaces. 

![Mt. St. Helens eruption](data:image/jpeg;base64,)
 







## Vegetation Recovery Overtime
Another thing to mention is the growth and recoover of the vegetation overtime, Using satellite imagery to show the vegetation health *(in red)* overtime, you can see that the natural surroundings have not only recovered but have even gotten better. Creating new life and enviroments as well as sub ecosystems for those new lives to live in. The eruption created hundreds of new ponds, streams, trails and lakes that weren't there **40** years ago.


![Vegetation recovery](https://cdn.mos.cms.futurecdn.net/6mUnWeuqySPMsSCiMCig99.jpg)
